summary.overview: The 'Speed Typer' web application is a typing game where users type displayed words as quickly and accurately as possible within a time limit. The game tracks the user's score, adjusts the time based on difficulty, and ends when the timer reaches zero. Users can customize the difficulty level through a settings menu.
summary.predefined_options: Difficulty levels: Easy, Medium, Hard. Each level adjusts the time added per correct word (Easy: +5s, Medium: +3s, Hard: +2s).

requirements.description: When the user clicks the 'Settings' button, the settings form should toggle between visible and hidden states.
The settings form must allow the user to select a difficulty level (Easy, Medium, Hard) from a dropdown menu. The selected difficulty should be saved to localStorage and persist across sessions.
The application must display a random word from a predefined list in the word display area when the game starts or when the user types the correct word.
The user must be able to type into the input field. If the typed word matches the displayed word, the input field should clear, the score should increment by 1, and a new word should be displayed.
When the user types the correct word, the remaining time should increase based on the selected difficulty level (Easy: +5s, Medium: +3s, Hard: +2s).
The application must display the remaining time in seconds. The time should decrement by 1 every second and update the display accordingly.
When the timer reaches zero, the game should end, and an end game message should be displayed with the user's final score and a 'Play Again' button.
The 'Play Again' button in the end game message should reload the page and restart the game.
The application must display the user's current score in the score display area, which updates in real-time as the user types correct words.
The application must focus the cursor on the input field when the game starts to allow immediate typing.
The application must initialize the difficulty dropdown to the value stored in localStorage or default to 'Medium' if no value is stored.
The application must visually display the end game container with a flex layout when the game ends.
